snippet: The Hall of Fame slugger Ralph Kiner began broadcasting for the Mets in their first year and is still going a half century later.
abstract: Profile of 89-year-old Ralph Kiner, last surviving member of New York Mets first broadcast team; Kiner, who has endured through two owners, three stadiums, record losing seasons, two World Series championships and many bizarre twists, appears less on SNY these days, but remains a perceptive analyst who is unafraid to criticize players.
lead_paragraph: The Hall of Fame slugger Ralph Kiner began broadcasting for the Mets in their first year and is still going a half century later.

headline.seo: Ralph Kiner Reflects on 50 Years as a Mets Voice
headline.main: 50 Years at the Mike for the Mets
